divs: Sighting DetailsWhile walking my dog in Demarest NJ (Wakelee field), I looked up and saw what at first looked to be a very bright star. As I stopped to watch, I noticed that it was moving very very slow, in a northwesterly direction, as I continued to observe the object, another object flew directly behind it, and directly overhead. On the same course as the first object. As I stated in the short description, both objects were extremely bright and looked like extremely bright stars; except alot larger and much closer. The conditions were partly cloudy, and the height of the clouds was approximately 3600 - 5500 feet above sea level according to the weather station that I logged into. These 2 objects were flying below the cloud coverage, and directly overhead, and made absolutely no sound at all. I know this is a busy airspace, as planes are constantly flying into Stewart Airport, and going to Newark Airport. I can say without a doubt that these were not aircraft, nor were they helicopters. The sighting lasted from 20:11 to 20:13. When I noticed the first object I looked at the time, and when the second object disappeared behind the trees, the time was 20:13.
Summary: While looking up saw extremely bright light followed by another bright light
trends: There have been no other sightings in Demarest
This sighting has never been favorited.
